member.name: T:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command
member.summary: This is a unique command that specifies transaction type.

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.SalaryPayment
member.summary: This supports sending money to both registere and unregistered M-Pesa customers.

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.BusinessPayment
member.summary: This is a normal business to customer payment, supports only M-Pesa registered customers.

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.PromotionPayment
member.summary: This is a promotional payment to customers. The M-Pesa notification message is a congratulatory message. Supports only M-Pesa registered customers.

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.TransactionReversal
member.summary: Reversal for an erroneous C2B transaction

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.AccountBalance
member.summary: Used to check the balance in a paybill/buy goods account (includes utility, MMF, Merchant, Charges paid account).

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.CustomerPayBillOnline
member.summary: Used to simulate a transaction taking place in the case of C2B Simulate Transaction or to initiate a transaction on behalf of the customer (STK Push).

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.TransactionStatusQuery
member.summary: Used to query the details of a transaction.

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.CheckIdentity
member.summary: Similar to STK push, uses M-Pesa PIN as a service.

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.BusinessPayBill
member.summary: Sending funds from one paybill to another paybill

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.BusinessBuyGoods
member.summary: sending funds from buy goods to another buy goods.

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.DisburseFundsToBusiness
member.summary: Transfer of funds from utility to MMF account.

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.BusinessToBusinessTransfer
member.summary: Transferring funds from one paybills MMF to another paybills MMF account.

member.name: F:MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command.BusinessTransferFromMMFToUtility

member.name: M:MpesaSDK.NET.MpesaClient.STKPushAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Int64,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command)
member.summary: Use this API to initiate online payment on behalf of a customer.
member.param: The organization receiving the funds. The parameter expected is a 5 to 6 digit as defined on the Shortcode description above. This can be the same as BusinessShortCode value above
The phone number sending money. The parameter expected is a Valid Safaricom Mobile Number that is M-Pesa registered in the format 2547XXXXXXXX
The amount to be transacted.
PassKey from safaricom portal
A CallBack URL is a valid secure URL that is used to receive notifications from M-Pesa API. It is the endpoint to which the results will be sent by M-Pesa API.

Account Reference: This is an Alpha-Numeric parameter that is defined by your system as an Identifier of the transaction for CustomerPayBillOnline transaction type. Along with the business name, this value is also displayed to the customer in the STK Pin Prompt message. Maximum of 12 characters.
This is any additional information/comment that can be sent along with the request from your system. Maximum of 13 Characters.
This is the transaction type that is used to identify the transaction when sending the request to M-Pesa. The transaction type for M-Pesa Express is "CustomerPayBillOnline"

member.name: M:MpesaSDK.NET.MpesaClient.StkPushQueryAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Use this API to check the status of a Lipa Na M-Pesa Online Payment
member.param: This is organizations shortcode (Paybill or Buygoods - A 5 to 6 digit account number) used to identify an organization and receive the transaction.
This is a global unique identifier of the processed checkout transaction request.; ws_CO_DMZ_123212312_2342347678234.
passkey: from safaricom

member.name: M:MpesaSDK.NET.MpesaClient.B2CAsync(System.String,System.String,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command,System.Int64,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Use this API to transact between an M-Pesa short code to a phone number registered on M-Pesa.
member.param: The username of the M-Pesa B2C account API operator. NOTE: the access channel for this operator myst be API and the account must be in active status
Initiator Password

This is a unique command that specifies B2C transaction type. SalaryPayment: This supports sending money to both registere and unregistered M-Pesa customers. BusinessPayment: This is a normal business to customer payment, supports only M-Pesa registered customers. PromotionPayment: This is a promotional payment to customers.The M-Pesa notification message is a congratulatory message.Supports only M-Pesa registered customers.
The amount of money being sent to the customer.
This is the B2C organization shortcode from which the money is to be sent.
This is the customer mobile number to receive the amount. - The number should have the country code (254) without the plus sign.
Any additional information to be associated with the transaction.
This is the URL to be specified in your request that will be used by API Proxy to send notification incase the payment request is timed out while awaiting processing in the queue.
This is the URL to be specified in your request that will be used by M-Pesa to send notification upon processing of the payment request.
Any additional information to be associated with the transaction.

member.name: M:MpesaSDK.NET.MpesaClient.B2BAsync(System.String,System.String,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command,System.Int64,System.String,System.String,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.IdentifierType,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.IdentifierType,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This API enables Business to Business (B2B) transactions between a business and another business. Use of this API requires a valid and verified B2B M-Pesa short code for the business initiating the transaction and the both businesses involved in the transaction.
member.param: This is the credential/username used to authenticate the transaction request.
Initiator Password

Unique command for each transaction type, possible values are: BusinessPayBill, MerchantToMerchantTransfer, MerchantTransferFromMerchantToWorking, MerchantServicesMMFAccountTransfer, AgencyFloatAdvance
The amount being transacted.
Organization’s short code initiating the transaction.
Organization’s short code receiving the funds being transacted.
Type of organization sending the transaction.
Type of organization receiving the funds being transacted.
Comments that are sent along with the transaction.
The path that stores information of time out transactions.it should be properly validated to make sure that it contains the port, URI and domain name or publicly available IP.
The path that receives results from M-Pesa it should be properly validated to make sure that it contains the port, URI and domain name or publicly available IP.
Account Reference mandatory for “BusinessPaybill” CommandID.

member.name: M:MpesaSDK.NET.MpesaClient.C2BRegisterUrlAsync(System.String,System.String,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.ResponseType,System.String)
member.summary: Use this API to register validation and confirmation URLs on M-Pesa
member.param: This is the URL that receives the validation request from API upon payment submission. The validation URL is only called if the external validation on the registered shortcode is enabled. (By default External Validation is dissabled)
This is the URL that receives the confirmation request from API upon payment completion.

This parameter specifies what is to happen if for any reason the validation URL is nor reachable. Note that, This is the default action value that determines what MPesa will do in the scenario that your endpoint is unreachable or is unable to respond on time. Only two values are allowed: Completed or Cancelled. Completed means MPesa will automatically complete your transaction, whereas Cancelled means MPesa will automatically cancel the transaction, in the event MPesa is unable to reach your Validation URL.
The short code of the organization.

member.name: M:MpesaSDK.NET.MpesaClient.C2BSimulateTransactionAsync(MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command,System.Int64,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This API is used to make payment requests from Client to Business (C2B). You can use the sandbox provided test credentials down below to simulates a payment made from the client phone's STK/SIM Toolkit menu, and enables you to receive the payment requests in real time.
member.param: This is a unique identifier of the transaction type: There are two types of these Identifiers: CustomerPayBillOnline: This is used for Pay Bills shortcodes. CustomerBuyGoodsOnline: This is used for Buy Goods shortcodes.
This is the amount being transacted. The parameter expected is a numeric value.
This is the phone number initiating the C2B transaction.
This is used on CustomerPayBillOnline option only. This is where a customer is expected to enter a unique bill identifier, e.g an Account Number.
This is the Short Code receiving the amount being transacted.

member.name: M:MpesaSDK.NET.MpesaClient.AccountBalanceAsync(System.String,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.IdentifierType,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command)
member.summary: Use this API to enquire the balance on an M-Pesa BuyGoods (Till Number).
member.param: Organization receiving the transaction
Type of organization receiving the transaction
The name of Initiator to initiating the request
Initiator Password
The path that stores information of time out transaction
The path that stores information of transaction
Comments that are sent along with the transaction.
Takes only 'AccountBalance' CommandID

member.name: M:MpesaSDK.NET.MpesaClient.ReversalAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.IdentifierType,System.String,System.Int64,System.String,System.String,System.String,MpesaSDK.NET.Enums.Command,System.String)
member.summary: Transaction Reversal API reverses a M-Pesa transaction.
member.param: The name of Initiator to initiating the request; Organization/MSISDN sending the transaction.
password for the initiator to authenticate the transaction request
Organization receiving the transaction; -Shortcode (6 digits)
Type of organization receiving the transaction
Transaction to reverse; E.g. LKXXXX1234
The path/url endpoint that stores information of time out transaction
The path/url endpoint that stores information of transaction
Comments that are sent along with the transaction.; sequence of characters up to 100
Takes only 'TransactionReversal' Command id; TransactionReversal
Optional Parameter; sequence of characters up to 100.
